meanings.sent1: The radio station rebroadcasted the news bulletin for listeners who missed it earlier.
meanings.sent2: The TV channel rebroadcasted the popular show due to high demand from viewers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would rebroadcasted his stand-up routine to make his audience laugh twice as hard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rebroadcasted through the room, infecting everyone with joy.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice rebroadcasted the instructions, ensuring every student understood clearly.

meanings.sent1: The satellite rebroadcasted the signal to reach remote areas with poor reception.
meanings.sent2: The internet provider rebroadcasted the Wi-Fi signal to improve connectivity in the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to rebroadcasted its chatter, mimicking the sounds of the forest.
meanings.sent4: His smile rebroadcasted warmth and kindness to everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The echo rebroadcasted his words, creating a surreal effect in the empty cave.
